EmoteActions.Message: The hermit strains to read the handwriting, then returns the note to you.
I wrote this?
Yes, yes it seems I did write this, so very long ago...
The secret...yes, the secret -- I remember something now.
The hermit's eyes grow wide as he looks at the diamond relic.
So you found the golems then?  I trust they did not give you too much trouble -- I see a stout and strong dead-eye when I look into your eyes!
Do not lose this priceless artifact.  You will need to harness the magical, protective power found within it -- eventually.

Ah, but you have so much to do yet.  Let us not delay any longer!  You must venture to the Itheanc Cathedral, in the Veseyan Islands.  The horrible fleshless dead, the blood fiends, have a most precious treasure in their possession -- a bright, silvery ring.
You must find this ring, for it contains a most vital magical element.
The hermit rolls the ring back and forth in his hand slowly, thinking deeply about the past.
A warding ring...
Long ago I took a ring identical to this one from the charred and burning hand of a fiend.  That time seems unreal to me now, beyond my grasp in memory.
I do remember some of the important details, though.  This ring conceals a small glass vial containing blood.  You will need this foul fluid.
There is no way for either of us to remove the vial from the ring, I'm afraid.  But there is one who can -- one who knows of the darker magics.
You must locate the seer that calls the wild jungles of Aphus Lassel her home, and show this ring to her.
She will know what to do, and she will help you.
So you have been to the seer's jungle abode?  You seem to be handling all of this adventure and excitement quite easily.
Hold onto this vial as if your life depended on it.  The blood will be useful...but I am having trouble remembering in what way.
Oh, what an awful smell!  I remember this stench more than ever!  I hope the experience did not make you too ill.
The old hermit thinks hard for a few moments.
I remember...I took the fur somewhere, and it was fashioned into a sturdy piece of rope, or cord if you will.
I am sorry, but I cannot recall how this was accomplished.  You will have to figure out a way to bind or weave this fur.
Ah, you've done it -- I knew you would find a way!
Suddenly a thought bursts into your mind:  "The blood will strengthen the bond."  Had Kleeoh said this?
I remember now!  The braided tusker fur is physically strong, indeed -- however it must be magically strong as well, otherwise it is useless.
The hermit pulls on the ends of the blood-soaked cord, testing it's toughness.

You could not have done better!  This braided cord, soaked in the black blood of the fiends, will serve as a bridge between the two idol guardians.  It will also bind the powerful magic of the idols to your weapon.
Speaking of idols, you will be pleased to know there is only one more relic to obtain.
The diamond relic will provide magical protection, but used alone it is heavy and unbalancing.  You would hardly be able to steady your weapon with only one idol hanging from it!
A similar idol is necessary not only to balance the weight of the first idol, but to balance it's protective powers as well.

It is getting late, so I will not keep you any longer.  You must make your way to Marae Lassel, and retrieve a relic from the Great Elariwood golems that inhabit the wild northern forests of that island.
You will know it when you see it.  An elariwood idol is very similar to a diamond idol in appearance.  Find it and return to me.
The hermit eyes the elariwood idol, hefting the weight of the relic in his hands.
You should be proud of yourself!  These creatures do not part with their treasures easily.  This elariwood idol is the final component of my secret -- and your quest.
You should now have the items necessary to create your own fetish.  Attach the blood-soaked cord to the ancient diamond idol first, then to the great elariwood idol.
You are doing well.  Do you now see why the second idol is needed?
If you were to attach this incomplete fetish to your weapon, it would become so unbalanced and unwieldy you would not be able to aim or fire it!
The great elariwood golems which roam the northern plains of Marae Lassel will provide you with the second and final idol.
DarkIdolsCompleted
TalkedToLighthouseHermit
Do you intend to linger?  I suppose I could make some cinnamon tea if you'd like to stay a while longer...if only I could remember where I put the cinnamon.
What were we talking about?  Oh that's right, your departure!  Hurry along now and return soon!
I can't remember if you were arriving or leaving -- I am just that old.
When I was your age I had to walk uphill in the snow both ways to get to the Lyceum.  You kids have it easy these days.
If you aren't leaving, at least make yourself useful.  Go stand at the bottom of the tower and put this apple on your head.  I want to try something...
Another fetish?  This one has been bound even shoddier than the last one!
I suppose I can try to fix this one as well...
The hermit struggles with the fetish for a moment, then hands it back to you -- obviously disappointed with himself.
I am sorry, but my hands are far too weak to fix this now.
When my strength returns, I should be able to help you.  But who knows when that will be?
The hermit's eyes grow wide as he begins to speak.
Ah, I do remember now.  I didn't think it would take this long, but no matter - you are here.  If you will but listen to my story, I will reveal a great secret to you.
I once was the greatest and most feared arbalister in all of Dereth.  I once had everything a man could want from this life, and I have enjoyed all that I have experienced over the long years.

But decades of adventure and excitement have caught up finally, I'm afraid.  I find myself unable to see the bull's-eye any longer, thanks to the slow dimming of my sight.  And more often than not I find the string to be too powerful for these feeble hands to draw or load.

However, a ghost of the past still stirs in this old body.  And before death's final arrow tears through the dark night in search of this weary target, I must see to it that my secret becomes known -- it is with you I entrust this knowledge.
The old hermit shifts his position, and begins to talk with a slow and deliberate voice.
I have seen with my own eyes the devastating power of magic; how easily a burning fireball can send the most skilled archer to his demise!
It has long been said:  "The only way to combat magic is with stronger magic."  Before you sits an old man who has come to understand what this truly means.
I obtained certain artifacts and studied about old, forgotten magic.  I devised for myself a way to empower my crossbow with a powerful, arcane device - a fetish, one might call it.

Any missile weapon may be empowered similarly.  Be warned - the magic is strong, and thus irreversible by any process I know of.  I will tell you all I can remember soon enough.  But today I have talked long enough.

Travel now to Aerlinthe Island.  Find the old ones, the ancient diamond behemoths roaming that enchanted, volcanic isle.  Retrieve the ancient diamond relic, and return to me.  I should more clearly see the past when I am again holding a piece of it.
TalkedToLighthouseHermit
You are truly a hunter worthy of this powerful magic fetish.  I have no doubt that you are excited to head out and t--
The hermit stutters, then begins to laugh loudly.
Aha!  It's a good thing you showed this to me.  You did not properly secure the idols to the cord!
The hermit rebinds the cord to both idols, using a method of tying you have never seen before.
DarkIdolsCompleted
There you are.  It took some effort, but I have fixed it for you.
You have done well.  I am very content in the knowledge that the secret will not die with me now.
One final request:  Tell no one of what you have learned from me!
